path_1.title: Run Lola Run (Lola rennt) (1998)
path_1.feeling: Clever structure and propulsive energy, more fun than deep but very satisfying.

path_1.title: Passage to India, A (1984)
path_1.feeling: Handsome and thoughtful, a bit stately, but I was absorbed.

path_1.title: Bambi (1942)
path_1.feeling: Lyrical, tender, and artful - classic Disney storytelling that still moves me.

path_1.title: Mad Hot Ballroom (2005)
path_1.feeling: Sweet and sincere

path_1.title: Mr. Blandings Builds His Dream House (1948)
path_1.feeling: Cary Grant chaos with gentle wit - old-school comfort comedy done right.

path_1.title: Grifters, The (1990)
path_1.feeling: Tart, fatalistic neo-noir with sharp edges - right up my alley.

path_1.title: My Architect: A Son's Journey (2003)
path_1.feeling: Intimate and probing

path_1.title: West Side Story (1961)
path_1.feeling: Soaring music and doomed romance - grand, kinetic, and stirring.

path_1.title: Brazil (1985)
path_1.feeling: Nightmarish, imaginative satire - bleakly funny and visually intoxicating.

path_1.title: Out of the Past (1947)
path_1.feeling: Silken, fatalistic noir perfection - couldn't ask for more.

path_1.title: Dead of Night (1945)
path_1.feeling: Atmospheric and uncanny

path_1.title: Easter Parade (1948)
path_1.feeling: Effortless charm and top-tier song-and-dance - pure pleasure.

path_1.title: Seconds (1966)
path_1.feeling: Eerie and haunting

path_1.title: Against All Odds (1984)
path_1.feeling: Glossy and moody, enjoyable but not essential.

path_1.title: Desert Fox, The (1951)
path_1.feeling: Sturdy, respectable wartime biopic

path_1.title: Spanish Prisoner, The (1997)
path_1.feeling: Elegant, clockwork con with cool reserve that I appreciated.

path_1.title: Grifters, The (1990)
path_1.feeling: Tart, fatalistic neo-noir with sharp edges - right up my alley.

path_1.title: Pygmalion (1938)
path_1.feeling: Witty, crisp, and beautifully played - classical delight.

path_1.title: English Patient, The (1996)
path_1.feeling: Handsome but ponderous

path_1.title: M*A*S*H (a.k.a. MASH) (1970)
path_1.feeling: Acerbic and loose-limbed

path_1.title: Nothing Sacred (1937)
path_1.feeling: Breezy, biting screwball - nasty in all the right ways.

path_1.title: Last Picture Show, The (1971)
path_1.feeling: Melancholic, finely etched Americana that stuck with me.

path_1.title: Picnic at Hanging Rock (1975)
path_1.feeling: Hypnotic mystery

path_1.title: Teacher's Pet (1958)
path_1.feeling: Light, likable star chemistry

path_1.title: Charlie and the Chocolate Factory (2005)
path_1.feeling: Inventive visuals, but the whimsy feels forced and hollow.

path_1.title: Brazil (1985)
path_1.feeling: Nightmarish, imaginative satire - bleakly funny and visually intoxicating.

path_1.title: Dead End (1937)
path_1.feeling: Tough, compassionate street drama with vivid period texture.

path_1.title: Passage to India, A (1984)
path_1.feeling: Handsome and thoughtful, a bit stately, but I was absorbed.

path_1.title: Night and the City (1950)
path_1.feeling: Relentless, sweaty noir desperation - I loved the grit.
